content: <ce:section-title>Synthesis of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6CHF<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Ag (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Freshly prepared Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was added to 1 ml of a concentrated aqueous solution of CHF<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Ag and AgBF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (molar ratio ∼1:1) in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was filtered off, the filtrate was placed in a desiccator charged with P<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>. Colorless block-like crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were obtained in ca. 70% yield after several days.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [HPyCH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OH][Ag<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>(C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)(CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>(HPyCH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OH)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]·0.5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was added to 1 ml of an aqueous solution of CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Ag (0.442 g, 2 mmol) and AgBF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (0.389 g, 2 mmol) in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was filtered off, and 50 mg PyCH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OH was added to the filtrate. The resulting suspension was transferred to a thick-walled glass tube. The tube was subsequently flame-sealed and kept in a furnace at 115<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 6 h, and then cooled down to room temperature (r.t.) at 6° h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>. Colorless prismatic crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were isolated in good yield (>50%). Anal. Found: C, 17.02; H, 0.77; N, 1.15. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">21.5</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">27</ce:inf>Ag<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>: C, 17.01; H, 0.85; N, 1.24%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·5CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Ag·2MeCN·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">Compound <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was prepared by adding Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> to 1 ml of a concentrated aqueous solution of 1.5 g CF<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Ag in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was filtered off, and a few drops of MeCN were added to the filtrate. (Note: excess MeCN would lead to deposition of Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> as a white precipitate.) The resulting solution was placed in a desiccator charged with P<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>. Colorless block-like crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were obtained in ca. 20% yield after several days.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of Ag2C2⋅6CHF2CO2Ag (1)

Freshly prepared Ag2C2 was added to 1 ml of a concentrated aqueous solution of CHF2CO2Ag and AgBF4 (molar ratio ~1:1) in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag2C2 was filtered off, the filtrate was placed in a desiccator charged with P2O5. Colorless block-like crystals of 1 were obtained in ca. 70% yield after several days.

Synthesis of [HPyCH2OH][Ag9(C2)(CF3CO2)9(HPyCH2OH)(H2O)]⋅0.5H2O (2)

Ag2C2 was added to 1 ml of an aqueous solution of CF3CO2Ag (0.442 g, 2 mmol) and AgBF4 (0.389 g, 2 mmol) in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag2C2 was filtered off, and 50 mg PyCH2OH was added to the filtrate. The resulting suspension was transferred to a thick-walled glass tube. The tube was subsequently flame-sealed and kept in a furnace at 115°C for 6 h, and then cooled down to room temperature (r.t.) at 6° h-1. Colorless prismatic crystals of 2 were isolated in good yield (>50%). Anal. Found: C, 17.02; H, 0.77; N, 1.15. Calc. for C32H19N2O21.5F27Ag9: C, 17.01; H, 0.85; N, 1.24%.

Synthesis of Ag2C2⋅5CF3SO3Ag⋅2MeCN⋅2H2O (3)

Compound 3 was prepared by adding Ag2C2 to 1 ml of a concentrated aqueous solution of 1.5 g CF3SO3Ag in a plastic beaker with stirring until saturated. The excess amount of Ag2C2 was filtered off, and a few drops of MeCN were added to the filtrate. (Note: excess MeCN would lead to deposition of Ag2C2 as a white precipitate.) The resulting solution was placed in a desiccator charged with P2O5. Colorless block-like crystals of 3 were obtained in ca. 20% yield after several days.

solution.name: concentrated aqueous solution of CHF2CO2Ag and AgBF4
aqueous solution of CF3CO2Ag and AgBF4
